missionProperties.missionDescription: Heroes must bring a Spectre ally to this mission. If the heroes have not earned a Spectre ally, they earn one Spectre ally of their choice for this mission only. ==== The Empire has tightened its grip on Lothal. One officer, Colonel Xarok, has become infamous for his brutal practices. An agent local to Lothal will rendezvous with you to send a message: the Rebellion will not let this stand.
missionProperties.campaignName: Ezra Bridger & Kanan Jarrus Ally Pack
missionProperties.additionalMissionInfo: Heroes must bring a Spectre ally to this mission. If they have not earned one, they earn one Spectre ally of their choice for this mission only.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You advance on the cantina where the tyrannical Colonel Xarok regularly makes his headquarters and resolve to make an example of this vicious man.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Doors are locked.

eventActions.tbText: Two of Xarok's lieutenants immediately turn their attention towards you.

The lieutenants must carry the code to the door. You ready your weapons. 

{-} When both Imperial Officers are defeated, the door to the Market unlocks.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Market opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Doors are locked. When both Imperial Officers are defeated, the door to the Market unlocks.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Market opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
You subdue Xarok with several swift punches and bind him to the nearby desk. Despite his pleas, you leave him at the citizens' mercy.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} If playing as a side mission, heroes receive 1 Spectre ally of their choice as an ally.

eventActions.mainText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
Xarok and his guards overwhelm you, and you are forced to retreat. As you fly away, you see Xarok's men beating and imprisoning locals as surrogate punishment for your crimes.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.mainText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
Shortly after your departure, N-4M informs you of the current situation in Xarok's former district: Imperial forces have attempted to regain control, but have encountered fierce resistance.

"These are good people," Ezra says as you return to the Ghost. "They're fed up with the Empire, and they don't want to be bullied by Thrawn any longer."

"I think Thrawn got the message," Kanan interjects. "That we're not going to let them get us down. And that he can't stop us."

{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 200 credits per hero.

eventActions.tbText:
Aboard the Ghost, you find Hera and Sabine scrutinizing the remains of an E-XD infiltrator droid. “We've found more than one of these things trying to follow us lately,’" Hera says. “And Thrawn isn't letting up. We need to even the odds.”

“So we give them something else to worry about,” suggests Sabine. “Even if it only ties up some stormtroopers. We didn't get to stay on Geonosis long enough for me to check, but I think we might be able to get some of those old battle droids working.”

“Or,” Hera puts in, “we can try to help the Twi'lek rebels on Ryloth. The Empire’s been intercepting their supplies for a while now. If we can help them put up more of a fight, that will be one more thing for Thrawn to worry about.”

{-} The heroes collectively choose whether to check out the droid factory or assist the Twi'lek rebels.
{-} If the heroes choose to check out the droid factory, the next active mission is “Siege on Geonosis”.
{-} If the heroes choose to assist the Twi'lek rebels, the next active mission is “Race on Ryloth”.

events.eventText:
N-4M informs you that Xarok has intensified his retaliatory measures and is cracking down harder than ever before. Ezra is shocked by the news. "These are good people. They don't deserve this."

"No one deserves this," Kanan agrees, placing a hand on Ezra's shoulder. "And for that reason, we won't give up. Win or lose, every fight is a spark that can ignite a bigger fire. We will show people that the rebellion is an alternative."

"Then we should see to it that the rebellion lasts long enough to take them all in," Ezra says soberly.

{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.tbText:
Aboard the Ghost, you find Hera and Sabine scrutinizing the remains of an E-XD infiltrator droid. “We've found more than one of these things trying to follow us lately,’" Hera says. “And Thrawn isn't letting up. We need to even the odds.”

“So we give them something else to worry about,” suggests Sabine. “Even if it only ties up some stormtroopers. We didn't get to stay on Geonosis long enough for me to check, but I think we might be able to get some of those old battle droids working.”

“Or,” Hera puts in, “we can try to help the Twi'lek rebels on Ryloth. The Empire’s been intercepting their supplies for a while now. If we can help them put up more of a fight, that will be one more thing for Thrawn to worry about.”

{-} The heroes collectively choose whether to check out the droid factory or assist the Twi'lek rebels.
{-} If the heroes choose to check out the droid factory, the next active mission is “Siege on Geonosis”.
{-} If the heroes choose to assist the Twi'lek rebels, the next active mission is “Race on Ryloth”.

events.eventText:
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.mainText:
You talk to the Twi'lek dancer, trying to sway her to your side.

{-} Test {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the Twi'lek, then discard all strain tokens on the Twi'lek. Enter the number of successes below.

events.eventText: The Twi'lek shakes her head vigorously. "Sorry. Xarok is a horrible man, but I have a family to think of. You're on your own." She rushes out of the cantina.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
A green-skinned Twi'lek woman in dancing clothes watches the confrontation wide-eyed, unsure whether or not to stand up against the tyrant.

{-} A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to the Twi'lek to try and gain her support ({J}).

events.eventText:
The Twi'lek ponders your words for a moment, then nods solemnly. "You are right. We all have to do our part. Down with Xarok!" She jumps down from the dancefloor and starts to grapple with one of the guards'.

{-} You gain 1 {e}.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The Twi'lek dancer is grappling with some of the guards, trying to keep them busy.

eventActions.mainText:
You talk to the Besalisk barkeeper, trying to sway him to your side.

{-} Test {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the Besalisk, then discard all strain tokens on the Besalisk. Enter the number of successes below.

events.eventText: The Besalisk grinds his teeth. "You don't know how strong Xarok is", he growls, then opens a hatch to the cellar and disappears underground.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The Besalisk barkeeper is cowering behind the counter, unsure whether or not to stand up against the tyrant.

{-} A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to the Besalisk to try and gain his support ({J}).

events.eventText:
The Besalisk hesitates, then slams his fists on the counter. "You're right! We've been silent for too long! This is for all the people you have oppressed, Xarok!" He grabs glasses and mugs and starts throwing them at the guards.

{-} You gain 1 {e}.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The Besalisk barkeeper is peltering the guards with mugs and glasses, thrown with all four of his hands.

eventActions.mainText:
You talk to the Devaronian bouncer, trying to sway her to your side.

{-} Test {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the Devaronian, then discard all strain tokens on the Devaronian. Enter the number of successes below.

events.eventText: The Devaronian raises her large hands. "Nah. Sorry. Life under Xarok isn't great, but at least it's life. I'd rather wait and see who comes out on top." She quickly hurries out of the market.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The cantina's bouncer, a tall Devaronian woman, keeps out of the fight for now, unsure whether or not to stand up against the tyrant.

{-} A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to the Devaronian to try and gain her support ({J}).

events.eventText:
The Devaronian grins, showing pointed teeth. "Ah, well. At least this is going to be interesting, right? Down with all dictators!" She throws herself against a guard, tackling them to the ground.

{-} You gain 1 {e}.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The Devaronian bouncer is pounding the guards with both fists.

eventActions.mainText:
You talk to the human merchant, trying to sway him to your side.

{-} Test {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the human, then discard all strain tokens on the human. Enter the number of successes below.

events.eventText: The man just shakes his head. He is silent for long seconds, and then simply says: "No." He  dodges behind his market stall.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
One of the cantina's patrons, an old human male, tries to keep enjoying his drink, unsure whether or not to stand up against the tyrant.

{-} A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to the human to try and gain his support ({J}).

events.eventText:
The old man is silent for long seconds, a sad expression passing on his face. Then he clenches his hands into fists. "This has gone long enough, hasn't it?", he says softly. Then he suddenly extends his leg and trips one of the guards.

{-} You gain 1 {e}.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The old man is doing his best to be a nuisance to the guards.

events.eventText: Alerted by the commotion, a squad of stormtroopers rushes in.

eventActions.tbText:
The troopers' armor is glinting with new plating.

{-} Each figure in this group gains 1 {g}.

events.eventText:
You grab the code cylinders from the lieutenants.

{-} The door to the Market is now unlocked.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The door leading to the indoor market is unlocked.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Market opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText: You burst through the door and come face-to-face with Xarok's guards in the market and the cantina.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The door leading to the indoor market is locked tight.

{-} When both Imperial Officers are defeated, the Cantina Door unlocks.

eventActions.tbText: The tyrant shouts over a comm system, unaware of his impending downfall.

eventActions.customText:
{A} The other Imperial figure with the highest figure cost that is not <color="red">Focused</color> becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.
{A} TYRANNICAL ORDER: The other Imperial figure with the highest figure cost that can perform an attack attacks {rebel}.

eventActions.tbText: A trooper in black armor appears to have the code to the back room door.

{-} The door to the Back Room is locked. When the Door Guard (<color="red">Death Trooper</color>) is defeated, the door unlocks.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Back Room opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.
More of Xarok's bodyguards are gathered in the market and the cantina.
Most people flee as you burst in, but a few bystanders stay, unsure whether or not they should join the fight against Xarok.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
A green-skinned Twi'lek woman in dancing clothes watches the confrontation wide-eyed, unsure whether or not to stand up against the tyrant.

{-} A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to the Twi'lek to try and gain her support ({J}).

The Besalisk barkeeper is cowering behind the counter, unsure whether or not to stand up against the tyrant.

{-} A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to the Besalisk to try and gain his support ({J}).

The market's bouncer, a tall Devaronian woman, keeps out of the fight for now, unsure whether or not to stand up against the tyrant.

{-} A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to the Devaronian to try and gain her support ({J}).

One of the market merchants, an old human male, tries to keep out of trouble, unsure whether or not to stand up against the tyrant.

{-} A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to the human to try and gain his support ({J}).

eventActions.tbText: {-} Neutral mission tokens represent bystanders. A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to a bystander to try and gain their support ({J}).

eventActions.theText:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent bystanders. A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to a bystander to try and gain their support ({J}).
{-} The door to the Back Room is locked. When the Door Guard (<color="red">Death Trooper</color>) is defeated, the door unlocks.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Back Room opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText: The back room door slides open. Colonel Xarok is bent over a microphone, still shouting orders, trying to ignore you.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
A sturdy door leads into the back room. Xarok's angry voice can be heard from behind the door, shouting orders.

{-} The door to the Back Room is locked. When the <color="red">Death Trooper</color> is defeated, the door unlocks.

eventActions.tbText:
You need to subdue Xarok, but too much brutality is going to send the wrong signal.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with Colonel Xarok ({K} or {J}) to cause Xarok to suffer 1 {H} for each success. During this test, that Rebel figure may suffer 1 {C} to reroll any number of dice. Xarok cannot recover {H} and cannot suffer {H} through any means other than this interaction.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent bystanders. A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to a bystander to try and gain their support ({J}).
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with Colonel Xarok ({K} or {J}) to cause Xarok to suffer 1 {H} for each success. During this test, that Rebel figure may suffer 1 {C} to reroll any number of dice. Xarok cannot recover {H} and cannot suffer {H} through any means other than this interaction.
{-} The Rebels win when Colonel Xarok is defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
You take the code cylinder from the fallen Death Trooper.

{-} The door to the Back Room is now unlocked.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: A sturdy door leads into the back room. Xarok's angry voice can be heard from behind the door, shouting orders.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent bystanders. A hero can spend 1 movement point while on or adjacent to a bystander to try and gain their support ({J}).
{-} The Rebels win when Colonel Xarok is defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.
